subject: Communication
title: The Listening Organization: Systems That Hear
description: A fast breakdown of The Listening Organization: Systems That Hear for builders.

hook.text: Toyota gives every factory worker a cord to stop the entire production line. Any worker. Any time.

buildup.text: Listening organizations build systematic channels: suggestion systems, skip-level meetings, anonymous feedback, and.

discovery.text: Toyota's 'andon cord' philosophy led to industry-leading quality.

twist.text: Most organizations build listening systems but don't act on what they hear.

climax.text: True listening organizations close the loop: collect input, acknowledge it, act on it, and report back what changed.

punchline.text: An organization that listens but never acts isn't listening.

quiz.question: What is Toyota's 'andon cord' system?
options: A cord any worker can pull to stop the production line
